texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: LVM snapshots can be really handy when you're trying to take a backup of a running virtual machine. However, mounting the snapshot can be tricky if the logical volume is partitioned.
texts.text: LVM snapshots can be really handy when you're trying to take a backup of a running virtual machine. However, mounting the snapshot can be tricky if the logical volume is partitioned.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I have a virtual machine running  zoneminder  on one of my servers at home and I needed to take a backup of the instance with  rdiff-backup . I made a snapshot of the logical volume and attempted to mount it:
texts.text: I have a virtual machine running  zoneminder  on one of my servers at home and I needed to take a backup of the instance with  rdiff-backup . I made a snapshot of the logical volume and attempted to mount it:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
[root@i7tiny ~]# lvcreate -s -n snap -L 5G /dev/vg_i7tiny/vm_zoneminder
  Logical volume "snap" created
[root@i7tiny ~]# mount /dev/vg_i7tiny/snap /mnt/snap/
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/mapper/vg_i7tiny-snap,
       missing codepage or helper program, or other error
       In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
       dmesg | tail or so
texts.text:
[root@i7tiny ~]# lvcreate -s -n snap -L 5G /dev/vg_i7tiny/vm_zoneminder
  Logical volume "snap" created
[root@i7tiny ~]# mount /dev/vg_i7tiny/snap /mnt/snap/
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/mapper/vg_i7tiny-snap,
       missing codepage or helper program, or other error
       In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
       dmesg | tail or so

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Oops. The logical volume has partitions. We will need to mount the volume with an offset so that we can get the right partition. Figuring out the offset can be done fairly easily with fdisk:

texts.orig:

Units = sectors of 1 * 512 = 512 bytes

/dev/vg_i7tiny/vm_zoneminder1   *        2048     1026047      512000   83  Linux

/dev/vg_i7tiny/vm_zoneminder3       102825984   104857599     1015808   82  Linux swap / Solaris

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It looks like we have a small boot partition, a big root partition and a swap volume. We want to mount the second volume to copy files from the root filesystem. There are two critical pieces of information here that we need:
texts.text: It looks like we have a small boot partition, a big root partition and a swap volume. We want to mount the second volume to copy files from the root filesystem. There are two critical pieces of information here that we need:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's calculate how many bytes we need to skip when we mount the partition and then mount it:
texts.text: Let's calculate how many bytes we need to skip when we mount the partition and then mount it:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
[root@i7tiny ~]# echo "512 * 1026048" | bc
525336576
[root@i7tiny ~]# mount -o offset=525336576 /dev/mapper/vg_i7tiny-snap /mnt/snap/
[root@i7tiny ~]# ls /mnt/snap/
bin  boot  dev  etc  home  lib  lib64  lost+found  media  mnt  opt  proc  root  run  sbin  srv  sys  tmp  usr  var
texts.text:
[root@i7tiny ~]# echo "512 * 1026048" | bc
525336576
[root@i7tiny ~]# mount -o offset=525336576 /dev/mapper/vg_i7tiny-snap /mnt/snap/
[root@i7tiny ~]# ls /mnt/snap/
bin  boot  dev  etc  home  lib  lib64  lost+found  media  mnt  opt  proc  root  run  sbin  srv  sys  tmp  usr  var

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The root filesystem from the virtual machine is now mounted and we can copy some files from it. Don't forget to clean up when you're finished:
texts.text: The root filesystem from the virtual machine is now mounted and we can copy some files from it. Don't forget to clean up when you're finished:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
[root@i7tiny ~]# umount /mnt/snap/
[root@i7tiny ~]# lvremove -f /dev/vg_i7tiny/snap
  Logical volume "snap" successfully removed
texts.text:
[root@i7tiny ~]# umount /mnt/snap/
[root@i7tiny ~]# lvremove -f /dev/vg_i7tiny/snap
  Logical volume "snap" successfully removed
